decision_conditions:
1.	The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than 21 Septmber 2019.
Reason: In order to comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

2.	The development hereby permitted shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the following approved plans: P.12.01 Revision P3; 6467 - 1103 - Proposed Site Plan_P4; P.12.03 Revision P12; P.12.04 Revision P11; P.12.05 Revision P12; P.12.06 Revision P9; P.14.01 Revision P6; P14.02 Revision P6; P.14.03 Revision P7; P14.04 Revision P6; and P.14.05 Revision P5. 

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

3.	No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the building, including the conversion of the existing building, hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to ensure that the development has a satisfactory appearance and to comply with Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP26 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 June 2017 under planning ref. 3691/15/01.]

4.	The development shall not be occupied until a scheme of measures consistent with the principles of ‘Secure by Design’ has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

The Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme and retained thereafter.

Reason: In order to promote a safer environment and to comply with Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP26 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 16 May 2018 under planning ref. 3691/15/03.]

5.	No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

The details shall include details of the inclusion of SUDS technology to minimise surface water run-off. 

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details as approved and retained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to ensure that the development has a satisfactory appearance and to accord with Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document Trees and the Council's Trees and Landscaping Supplementary Planning Document Adopted June 2006, now superseded by  Policies LP21 and LP32 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 June 2017 under planning ref. 3691/15/01.]

6.	All planting, seeding or turfing comprised in the approved details pursuant to condition 5 shall be carried out in the first planting and/or seeding seasons following the first occupation of the buildings hereby permitted and shall comply with the specified requirements in BS3936 (1992) ‘Specification of Nursery Stock Pt 1: Trees and Shrubs’ and in BS4428 (1989) ‘Recommendations for General Landscaping Operations’. Any trees, plants or shrubs which within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season in accordance with the approved scheme, which shall be retained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to ensure that the development has a satisfactory appearance and to accord with Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document Trees and the Council's Trees and Landscaping Supplementary Planning Document Adopted June 2006, now superseded by  Policies LP26 and LP 38 of the Local Plan.

7.	The dwellings hereby permitted shall not be first occupied until the areas shown on the approved drawings for the parking of cars have been laid out and are available for use. Those areas shall not thereafter be used for any purpose other than the parking of vehicles. 

Reason: To ensure the compliance with Policies T5 and T6 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP23 of the Local Plan.

8.	The dwellings hereby permitted shall not be first occupied until details of all rooftop amenity spaces, including balustrades, privacy screens, soft and hard landscaping and furniture have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be retained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to ensure that the development has a satisfactory appearance and to accord with Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document Trees and the Council's Trees and Landscaping Supplementary Planning Document Adopted June 2006, now superseded by  Policies LP26, LP38 and LP39of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 May 2019 under planning ref. 3691/15/06.]

9.	No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of all walls, fences and/or boundary treatments to be erected within and on the boundaries of the site.  The approved walls, fences and/or boundary treatments shall be completed before the dwellings hereby permitted are first occupied in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter. 

Reason: In order to ensure that the development has a satisfactory appearance and to comply with Policy BD1 of the Council’s Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP26 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 June 2017 under planning ref. 3691/15/01.]

10.	Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking, re-enacting or modifying that Order), no extensions, roof alterations or outbuildings shall be erected.

Reason: In order to protect the privacy and amenities enjoyed by occupants of neighbouring properties and to comply with Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP26 of the Local Plan.

11.	Before the first occupation of the dwellings hereby permitted the first floor windows in the north east flank elevation that serve a bathroom and bedroom, as well as the loft rooflights, shall be fitted with obscured glass and shall be fixed shut to a level 1.7 metres above the internal floor levels of the rooms they serve. The windows shall be permanently retained in that condition.

Reason: To prevent the overlooking of the adjacent properties and comply with Policy BD1 of the Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP26 of the Local Plan.

12.	No development shall take place until details of electric vehicle charging points in accordance with London Plan Policy 6.13  for 20% of the vehicular parking spaces (10% active and 10% passive) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and retained thereafter.

Reason: To comply with London Plan Policy 6.13.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 June 2017 under planning ref. 3691/15/01.]

13.	No development shall take place until a scheme has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority describing the means by which construction traffic and activity shall be controlled. The details shall provide for: 
i) Construction traffic routes; 
ii) Construction traffic washing; 
iii) Public highway cleaning; 
iv) Dust suppression; 
v) Noise suppression; 
vi) Hours of working; and 
vii) Construction waste disposal. 

The development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed in accordance with the approved scheme.

Reason: In order to ensure that the construction of the development at this site is undertaken in a manner which minimises its’ effect on the local environment.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 5 April 2017 under planning ref. 3691/15/02.]

14.	Before occupation the dwellings shall comply with Building Regulations Optional Requirement Approved Document G2 – Water efficiency (2015 edition). Evidence of compliance shall be notified to the building control body appointed for the development in the appropriate Full Plans Application, or Building Notice, or Initial Notice to enable the building control body to check compliance.

Reason: To comply with London Plan Policy 5.15.

15.	The `as built ' stage Building Regulations Output Document from approved software shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority within one month of occupation of the development, confirming that the development has achieved minimum 35% reduction in carbon emissions from the Target Emissions Rate in Part L of the 2013 Building Regulations.

Reason: In order to ensure the optimum energy and resource efficiency measures, low-carbon and decentralised energy, and on-site renewable energy generation and to comply with Polices 5.2, 5.5, 5.6 and 5.7 of the London Plan, Policy BD1 of the Borough Wide Primary Polices DPD, and the sustainable Design and Construction SPD (January 2012), now superseded by  Policies LP20 and LP32 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 10 June 2019 under planning ref. 3691/15/05.]

16.	Prior to occupation eleven (11) of the dwellings hereby approved shall comply with Building Regulations Optional Requirement Approved Document M4 (2) Category 2: Accessible and adaptable dwellings and provide one (1) dwelling hereby approved shall comply with M4(3) Access to and use of buildings (2015 edition). Evidence of compliance shall be notified to the building control body appointed for the development in the appropriate Full Plans Application, or Building Notice, or Initial Notice to enable the building control body to check compliance.

Reason: In order to ensure that the development provides (or can be adapted to provide) satisfactory accommodation for people whose mobility is impaired, and to accord with Policy H2 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policies LP26 and LP32 of the Local Plan.

17.	Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to first occupation of the proposed development, a cycle parking plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority indicating the provision of 22 cycle parking spaces for the benefit of future residents of the development. The development shall not be occupied until such time as the approved details have been completed and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Reason: In order to ensure the development complies with Policy T5 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP23 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 May 2019 under planning ref. 3691/15/06.]

18.	Before the development hereby permitted commences at the site, details of measures to be taken to insulate and/or screen from external noise the residential units and amenity areas hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The measures as approved shall be provided at the site before any residential unit is first occupied, and retained thereafter in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In order to ensure that the residential accommodation and amenity areas to be provided are suitably protected from any external source of disturbance, and to accord with Policy SP3 of the Council's Core Strategy Development Plan Document and Policy BD1 of the Council's Borough Wide Primary Policies Development Plan Document, now superseded by  Policy LP26 of the Local Plan.

[Note: This condition was discharged on 20 May 2019 under planning ref. 3691/15/06.]
description: Variation of condition 2 of approved permission 3691/15: Alterations to location of bin stores and cycle stores. (Retrospective). (Summary)
